newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar closes slightly softer.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar closes slightly softer.

text.p: LIFFE white sugar finished easier on Thursday after selling in New York pressured an already weak market.
August ended $1.20 lower at $320.20 per tonnes, after bargain hunting pulled the contract off its low of $319.50.
October finished $1.10 easier at its low of $310.20.
Turnover was a chunky 2,923 lots, with 2,119 lots in August.
Traders said outright trade dealings dominated activity in London, and while interest was seen in August/October, there was increasing volume on the back spreads.
In Paris, August lost $1.30 to $320.0 and October shed 60 cents to $312.10.
